name: market for tempering, flat glass | tempering, flat glass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9747/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'tempering, flat glass', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The service "tempering, flat glass" represents the toughening of 1 kg of glass, a special process of solidification of a glass sheet in order to make it particularly resistant to breakages. The glass sheet is heated to a temperature just below its softening point (about 640Â°C, thermal tempering) and then immediately cooled by special jets of cold-air. These harden the surface of the glass, giving the inside more time to cool. This allows the external layer to crystallize into a wider lattice while the inside solidifies with greater compression than in the crystal lattice. The most common application is automotive glass. A user employing this module should add the respective amount of raw glass, as the throughput of raw glass is not included.

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
